messages.subject: Website You've All Been Waiting For
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.shinsengumi-exp.jp/ covering the sequel Jo Odagiri fan alert near the bottom just click on the Saitou link to see the making of pics of Hijikata
messages.messageBody:
http://www.shinsengumi-exp.jp/
covering the sequel

Jo Odagiri fan alert
near the bottom just click on the Saitou link to see "the making of" pics
of Hijikata and SAitou at Aizu going to Kondou's grave
----------------------------------------------------
Totally unrelated (((please help)))
If anyone here is in any way affiliated with UC Berkeley
(student/staff/admin which would allow you to borrow a library book)
please email secretarytocapt3(a)hotmail.com
Berkeley won't send the book to me--and a librarian even inquired as
to the reason why not--and we didn't get an answer

I pursued this matter for almost 2 months now and it is really
important to duplicate this book if possible (even if we can't read
it...yet)

The *only* library in the world (including the ones in Japan--the
database I use also covers universities in that country)---is BERKELEY
(T_T)

I totally realize the importance of a book written by Takagi
Morinusuke/Morinosuke
because now Japanese fans are saying they can't find it
either---ofcourse it was printed Taisho 1 (it wasn't supposed to be a
bestseller---but a biography of an older woman who wasn't a member of
the Joushitai but clearly left a profound impression on her nephew
from the Takagi family)

The book was published by Tatsuo's adopted father Numazawa Shichiro

Numasawa MIchiko-kun no den / ?????, 1854-

Japanese ?? 1, 19 leaves, [2] leaves of plates (1 folded) : ill. ; 23 cm.
